name: EC2ContainerServiceTaskDefinitionContainerDefinitions
description: ContainerDefinitions is a property of the AWS::ECS::TaskDefinition resource that describes the configuration of an Amazon EC2 Container Service (Amazon ECS) container. The container definitions are passed to the Docker daemon.

properties.name: Command
properties.description: The CMD value to pass to the container. For more information about the Docker CMD parameter, see https://docs.docker.com/reference/builder/#cmd.

properties.name: Cpu
properties.description: The minimum number of CPU units to reserve for the container. Containers share unallocated CPU units with other containers on the instance by using the same ratio as their allocated CPU units. For more information, see the cpu content for the ContainerDefinition data type in the Amazon EC2 Container Service API Reference.

properties.name: DisableNetworking
properties.description: Indicates whether networking is disabled within the container.

properties.name: DnsSearchDomains
properties.description: A list of DNS search domains that are provided to the container. The domain names that the DNS logic looks up when a process attempts to access a bare unqualified hostname.

properties.name: DnsServers
properties.description: A list of DNS servers that Amazon ECS provides to the container.

properties.name: DockerLabels
properties.description: A key-value map of labels for the container.
properties.typeDescription: Key-value pairs, with the name of the label as the key and the label value as the value.

properties.name: DockerSecurityOptions
properties.description: A list of custom labels for SELinux and AppArmor multi-level security systems. For more information, see the dockerSecurityOptions content for the ContainerDefinition data type in the Amazon EC2 Container Service API Reference.

properties.name: EntryPoint
properties.description: The ENTRYPOINT value to pass to the container. For more information about the Docker ENTRYPOINT parameter, see https://docs.docker.com/reference/builder/#entrypoint.

properties.name: Environment
properties.description: The environment variables to pass to the container.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions Environment

properties.name: Essential
properties.description: Indicates whether the task stops if this container fails. If you specify true and the container fails, all other containers in the task stop. If you specify false and the container fails, none of the other containers in the task is affected. This value is true by default.

properties.name: ExtraHosts
properties.description: A list of hostnames and IP address mappings to append to the /etc/hosts file on the container.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions HostEntry

properties.name: Hostname
properties.description: The name that Docker will use for the container's hostname.

properties.name: Image
properties.description: The image to use for a container, which is passed directly to the Docker daemon. You can use images in the Docker Hub registry or specify other repositories (repository-url/image:tag).

properties.name: Links
properties.description: The name of another container to connect to. With links, containers can communicate with each other without using port mappings.

properties.name: LogConfiguration
properties.description: Configures a custom log driver for the container. For more information, see the logConfiguration content for the ContainerDefinition data type in the Amazon EC2 Container Service API Reference.
properties.typeDescription: Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions LogConfiguration

properties.name: Memory
properties.description: The number of MiB of memory to reserve for the container. If your container attempts to exceed the allocated memory, the container is terminated.

properties.name: MountPoints
properties.description: The mount points for data volumes in the container.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions MountPoints

properties.name: Name
properties.description: A name for the container.

properties.name: PortMappings
properties.description: A mapping of the container port to a host port. Port mappings enable containers to access ports on the host container instance to send or receive traffic.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions PortMappings

properties.name: Privileged
properties.description: Indicates whether the container is given full access to the host container instance.

properties.name: ReadonlyRootFilesystem
properties.description: Indicates whether the container's root file system is mounted as read only.

properties.name: Ulimits
properties.description: A list of ulimits to set in the container. The ulimits set constraints on how much resources a container can consume so that it doesn't deplete all available resources on the host.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions Ulimit

properties.name: User
properties.description: The user name to use inside the container.

properties.name: VolumesFrom
properties.description: The data volumes to mount from another container.
properties.typeDescription: List of Amazon EC2 Container Service TaskDefinition ContainerDefinitions VolumesFrom

properties.name: WorkingDirectory
properties.description: The working directory in the container in which to run commands.
